chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: To get started, you create a root database and a client database that each run the SymmetricDS software to synchronize changes. You open registration for the client, which registers with the root to receive the synchronization configuration. You ask the root to reload the client in order to perform an initial synchronization. Then you make changes to the databases and observe the changes propagating.

section.title: Creating and Populating Your Databases
section.para:
Create new databases for the root and client nodes:
mysqladmin --user=root --password=secret create symrootdb mysqladmin --user=root --password=secret create symclientdb
We make the first node the root node with an initial set of data and the configuration that is needed by nodes that register.
mysql --user=root --password=secret < root_node.sql
The second node the root node with an initial set of data and the configuration that is needed by nodes that register.
